metadata.synopsis: A Manhattan professor's (David Selby) pregnant wife (Barbra Streisand) has fantasies, which include her mother and Fidel Castro.

reviews: [Streisand] does not give us a liberated woman, or even a woman working in some organized way toward liberation. Instead, she gives us a woman who feels free to be herself, no matter what anyone thinks.
Up the Sandbox is a lesser movie than most of the pictures Barbra Streisand has made. But it is a greater personal triumph.
